multiply.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times
multiply.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Children will learn to multiply in the second grade.
multiply.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to increase by a large amount or number, or to make something do this
multiply.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The amount of information available has multiplied.
Smoking multiplies the risk of heart attacks and other health problems.
multiply.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Bacteria multiply quickly in warm food.
multiply.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to increase greatly or to make something increase greatly
multiply.translation[1].definitions[0].e: This year we hope to multiply exports to about $1.7 million.
multiply.translation[1].definitions[1].d: to add a number to itself a particular number of times
multiply.translation[1].definitions[1].e: Multiply your salary by three to get your maximum loan.
